Transmissible Spongiform Encephalopathies: Etiology
Transmissible Spongiform
Encephalopathies: Etiology

agent not fully characterized smaller than smallest known virus ellicits no detectable immune or inflammatory response in the host resistant to most disinfectants and treatments which normally destroy nucleic acids
agent not fully characterized
smaller than smallest known virus
ellicits no detectable immune or inflammatory
response in the host
resistant to most disinfectants and treatments
which normally destroy nucleic acids

Transmissible Spongiform Encephalopathies: Agent Theories
Transmissible Spongiform
Encephalopathies: Agent Theories

VIRUS - unconventional, unusual biochemical and biopysical properties VIRINO - host-derived protein coat coupled to a small noncoding regulatory nucleic acid PRION - host-coded normal cellular protein becomes partially protease resistant through post tranlational conformation change
VIRUS - unconventional, unusual biochemical V I R U S - u n c o n v e n t i o n a l ,
u n u s u a l
b i o c h e m i c a l
and biopysical properties
VIRINO - host-derived protein coat coupled to V I R I N O - h o s t - d e r i v e d
p r o t e i n
c o a t
c o u p l e d
t o
a small noncoding regulatory nucleic acid
PRION - host-coded normal cellular protein P R I O N - h o s t - c o d e d
n o r m a l
c e l l u l a r
p r o t e i n
becomes partially protease resistant through
post tranlational conformation change

BSE Diagnostics
BSE Diagnostics

No live animal test No preclinical test Need brain tissue Histology, IHC, WB, ELISA "Negatives" do not guarantee absence of infectivity
No live animal test
No preclinical test
Need brain tissue
Histology, IHC, WB, ELISA
"Negatives" do not guarantee absence of
infectivity

TSE Diagnostics: EU Approved
TSE Diagnostics: EU Approved

Histology Standard IHC and Western Blot Prionics AG - modified Western Blot (8 hrs) Enfer Ltd. - High throughput chemiluminescent ELISA (3-4 hrs) CEA - Sandwich Immunoassay (3-4 hrs) all require brain/clinical cases
Histology
Standard IHC and Western Blot
Prionics AG - modified Western Blot (8 hrs)
Enfer Ltd. - High throughput chemiluminescent
ELISA (3-4 hrs)
CEA - Sandwich Immunoassay (3-4 hrs)
all require brain/clinical cases

BSE: Control Measures in EU
BSE: Control Measures in EU

SRM bans on sheep, goats, cattle (Oct 2000) Prohibit feeding of most processed animal proteins (excluded fish meal) to farmed animals (Jan 2001) test of all cattle >30months at slaughter (if cannot test destroy) (Jan 2001)
SRM bans on sheep, goats, cattle (Oct 2000)
Prohibit feeding of most processed animal
proteins (excluded fish meal) to farmed animals
(Jan 2001)
test of all cattle >30months at slaughter (if
cannot test destroy) (Jan 2001)

EU Categories of Risk
EU Categories of Risk

I - Highly Unlikely II - Unlikely but Cannot be excluded III -
I - Highly Unlikely

III -

Likely but not confirmed BSE confirmed at a lower level IV - BSE confirmed at a higher level
